newsitem.title: USA: Phoenix Duff sees Q1 earnings below views.
newsitem.headline: Phoenix Duff sees Q1 earnings below views.

text.p: Phoenix Duff & Phelps said Thursday that earnings for the first quarter ended March 31, 1997 will be below market expectations.
Analysts expected the company to earn $0.13 per share for the quarter and $0.58 for the year, according to First Call.

Philip R. McLoughlin, chief executive officer of Phoenix Duff & Phelps, said first quarter operating income will be slightly less than expected, but two non-recurring expenses will have a greater impact on reported earnings.
The first expense relates to the resignation of a senior executive and to his exercise of certain rights under his employment agreement, the company said.
The second relates to the dissolution of the Windy City CBO Partners LP, the company said.
In February, Windy City's portfolio was liquidated, the bondholders were paid off and the partnership was dissolved, resulting in an unexpected loss, the company said.
The company said it does not currently foresee any other negative non-recurring items for the balance of 1997.
